owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

quoteFeeForPriceUpdate(uint256,uint256).details: call this for value to attach to call to update token prices

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

shouldCallUpdateTokenPrices(uint256,uint.details: typically called by an off-chain watcher and if returns true updateTokenPrices is called

params._poolId1: one pool id of the pool pair
params._poolId2: the other pool id of the pool pair

returns._0: bool true if updateTokenPrice should be called, false otherwise

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

updateTokenPrices(uint256,uint256).details: anyone can update and sync price at any time even though the price is not changed

params._poolId1: one pool id of the pool pair
params._poolId2: the other pool id of the pool pair

getFees(uint256,uint256,uint16,address,u.notice: get the fees for a swap. typically called from the router via the pool

quoteFeeForPriceUpdate(uint256,uint256).notice: quote fee for price update and sync to remote chains

shouldCallUpdateTokenPrices(uint256,uint.notice: function to check if update token prices should be called

updateTokenPrices(uint256,uint256).notice: update the stored token price pair for the associated pool pair

userdoc.notice: Stargate fee library maintains the fees it costs to go from one pool to another across chains The price feeds are eagerly updated by off-chain actors who watch the shouldCallUpdateTokenPrices() and call updateTokenPrices() if required
